meanings.definition: A payment made in advance for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: I gave the seller prems for the new phone.
meanings.sent2: The company requested prems for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: He mistakenly offered prems for a pizza delivery.
meanings.sent4: Her prems for the concert tickets secured her entry.
meanings.sent5: The prems for the hotel room ensured a comfortable stay.

meanings.definition: The highest quality or grade of a product.
meanings.sent1: The prems of the fabric was evident in its softness.
meanings.sent2: Customers were willing to pay more for the prems of the wine.
meanings.sent3: She proudly displayed the prems of her homemade cake.
meanings.sent4: The prems of the jewelry made it a valuable heirloom.
meanings.sent5: The prems of the car was reflected in its sleek design.

meanings.definition: To pay in advance for something.
meanings.sent1: I will prems for the concert tickets to secure them early.
meanings.sent2: She decided to prems for the vacation rental to avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly offered to prems for the movie tickets a year in advance.
meanings.sent4: The company chose to prems for the raw materials to ensure timely delivery.
meanings.sent5: They had to prems for the event venue to confirm the booking.
